item.description:
MyEG assures investors about Indonesian ops - Business News  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services has assured fund managers about the expected losses at the Indonesia operations as it would over time, trim down its stake ...

item.title: MyEG posts quarterly net loss of RM97.47mil - Digital News Asia
item.description:
MyEG posts quarterly net loss of RM97.47mil  Digital News Asia

MYEG Services Bhd reported a net loss of RM97.47 million for its latest financial quarter ending Sept 30. Revenue was recorded at RM138.33 million. The loss ...

item.title: MyEG incurs net loss of RM97.5m for July-Sept quarter - New Straits Times
item.description:
MyEG incurs net loss of RM97.5m for July-Sept quarter  New Straits Times

KUALA LUMPUR: MY E.G. Services Bhd (MyEG) posted a net loss of RM97.47 million for the three-month period to Sept 30, 2018, against a net profit of ...

item.title: MyEG makes foray into Indonesia - New Straits Times
item.description:
MyEG makes foray into Indonesia  New Straits Times

PETALING JAYA: My E.G. Services Bhd (MyEG), through its wholly-owned sub-subsidiary, MY EG (Indonesia) Sdn Bhd, has signed a Memorandum of ...

item.title: MyEG posts quarterly net loss of RM97mil - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG posts quarterly net loss of RM97mil  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: MyEG Services Bhd has recorded a net loss of RM97.47mil for its July-to-Sept 30 quarter on the back of a revenue of RM138.33mil. The losses were mainly due to an impairment due from an associate company amounting to RM95.45mil, and the impairment of equipment amounting to RM76.29mil. This was in relation to the abolition of the goods and services tax (GST) regime. For the 15-month period from July 1, 2017 to Sept 30, the company recorded a net profit of RM129.02mil on the back of a revenue of RM564.57mil. MyEG is changing its year-end from June 30 to Sept 30. The better resul...

item.title: MyEG writes off GST investment, redeploys assets to other countries - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG writes off GST investment, redeploys assets to other countries  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MyEG Service Bhd posted its first ever quarterly loss in the three month through September on impairment charges related to the abolishment of the goods and services tax (GST) regime. The company, in a filing with Bursa Malaysia Thursday, said it made a net loss of RM97.5mil on revenue of RM138.3mil. MyEG, in a filing with Bursa Malaysia on Thursday, said its latest quarterly results were affected by impairment from an associate company amounting to RM95.45mil and impairment of equipment amounting to RM76.29mil. “The board wishes to clarify that necessary impairments have been...

item.title: Clarifying DneX’s eWork permit, MyEG renewal permit - The Star Online
item.description:
Clarifying DneX’s eWork permit, MyEG renewal permit  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Dagang NeXchange’s “eWork Permit” project has nothing to do with MyEG’s privatised project pertaining to the renewal of foreign workers working permit, CIMB Equities Research points out. It said on Friday it had organised a conference call with MyEG and its institutional investors to clarify concerns about DneX’s “eWork Permit” project. “DneX is building a new back-end system for Bukit Megah Sdn Bhd for the latter's rehiring programme. MyEG no longer allows Bukit Megah to use its back-end system,” it said. DneX would be paid RM30 per transaction of “eWork Permit”, which is the...

item.title: MyEG buys controlling stake in restaurant review portal - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG buys controlling stake in restaurant review portal  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services Bhd (MyEG) is buying a 67% stake in the EatDrinkKL digital platform that provides reviews and news on the food and beverage businesses. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the e-Government services provider said its unit My EG Capital Sdn Bhd had entered into a shareholders agreement with Essential Reviews Sdn Bhd - the sole owner of the EatDrinkKL’s intellectual property rights - and its only shareholder Sean Cornelius Yoong Wan Yen to purchase the stake. MyEG said the investment in Essential Reviews would allow it to expand its business in the online space which ...

item.title: MyEG in Philippines JV to implement e-government services - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG in Philippines JV to implement e-government services  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: My EG Services Bhd (MyEG) has inked a joint-venture (JV) agreement with I-Pay Commerce Ventures Inc (IPCVI) to set up a JV corporation (JVC) for the purpose of engaging in the business of development and implementation of electronic government services projects in the Philippines. This includes the provision of other services such as electronic payment in the Philippines. The investment for this will be fully funded via internal funds and is not subject to shareholders’ approval or any other relevant authorities. It is also not conditional upon any other corporate exercise be...

item.title: MyEG's 5 yr concession for foreign workers valued over RM553m - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG's 5 yr concession for foreign workers valued over RM553m  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My E.G. Services Bhd has confirmed the five-year concession with the government to provide online renewal of temporary employment pass for foreign workers at RM553.85mil. It said on Thursday it it had signed a concession agreement with the government to provide the service from May 23, 2015 to May 22, 2020. MyEG said the concession was renewable upon expiry subject to the government's approval. It expected the concession to contribute positively to the earnings and net assets per share of the company for the financial years ending June 30, 2017 onwards until the expiry of the ...

item.title: Trading ideas: SCGM, Berjaya Food, Ekovest, TSR, My EG and Digistar - The Star Online
item.description:
Trading ideas: SCGM, Berjaya Food, Ekovest, TSR, My EG and Digistar  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: JF Apex Research expects SCGM, Berjaya Food, Ekovest, TSR, My EG Services and Digistar to be among the stocks to watch on Thursday after their corporate news. It said SCGM’s 3QFY17 net profit dipped to RM6.98mil from RM7.05mil a year ago due to the higher cost of production resulting from an increase in resin price, higher depreciation of property, plant and equipment, and higher electricity consumption. As for Berjaya Food, the company posted a 36.83% on-year fall in 3QFY17 net profit mainly due to losses incurred by Kenny Rogers Roasters chain operation. This was due to weak...

item.title: MyEG forms management and consultancy services unit - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG forms management and consultancy services unit  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services Bhd (MyEG) has incorporated a new subsidiary to provide management and consultancy services. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the e-Government services provider said MY EG Management Services Sdn Bhd was set up with an authorised share capital of RM400,000. No details were provided on the areas of consultancy. One of the new businesses that MyEG entered into in the last year was operating hostels to foreign workers through sub-subsidiary MY EG Lodging Sdn Bhd, which was incorporated on July 20, 2016. About a month later, the 55%-owned subsidiary entered into thr...

item.title: What’s up with Excel Force? - The Star Online
item.description:
What’s up with Excel Force?  The Star Online

Why investors are chasing this stock SO just what is going on with Main Market-listed Excel Force MSC Sdn Bhd? Some price action in the last few weeks stirred interest in this company that provides application solutions for the stockbroking and banking industry. The stock is now up 51.26% on a year to date basis at RM1.80, giving it a market capitalisation of RM372.4mil. What is with all that anticipation? It clearly isn’t about the company’s existing business, as the company reported a 34.13% drop in net profit to RM5.63mil on the back of a 11.1% decrease in revenue to RM22.47mil for its f...

item.title: Analyst optimistic of MyEG overseas venture - The Star Online
item.description:
Analyst optimistic of MyEG overseas venture  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: My E.G. Services Bhd’s (MyEG) first successful overseas venture is expected to be positive for the e-government services provider, as it could benefit from the anticipated rising revenue from the venture’s concessions, moving forward. CIMB Research was optimistic of MyEG’s exploration of different markets via partnerships with local companies. MyEG’s entry into the venture will be helpful for its Philippines-based partner to grow further, backed by MyEG’s infrastructure capacity to set up electronic government services. The e-government services provider has inked a joint-ven...

item.title: Breakfast briefing: Monday, February 13 - The Star Online
item.description:
Breakfast briefing: Monday, February 13  The Star Online

MarketWatch: Buoyant oil prices since Donald Trump's election have provided no lasting halo effect for energy stocks as the sector's profit rebound has lacked vigour, but that could change in the week ahead with a fresh crop of quarterly scorecards. - Reuters Top foreign stories Asia remains vibrant: Moody’s Investors Service says Asia will remain among the fastest-growing region in 2017, but it faces several challenges that could weigh on credit conditions for Asian debt issuers. - StarBiz Drugmaker Stada confirms takeover bid from two companies: German generic drugmaker Stada said it has ...

item.title: MyEG on track for another record year with strong growth - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG on track for another record year with strong growth  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MY EG Services Bhd (MyEG) looks set for another record financial year with a double-digit growth, having delivered a 63% growth in earnings to RM53.9mil for the third quarter ended March 31, 2017. That raised its nine-month earnings to RM142.03mil, up 55% compared to the same period in the preceding financial year, according to the e-Government service provider’s latest interim financial report to the stock exchange. MyEG’s year-to-date earnings were already close to its earnings for the entire last financial year ended June 30, 2016 (RM142.52mil). Over the last five years, My...

item.title: Cycling from KL to Langkawi in aid of five homes - The Star Online
item.description:
Cycling from KL to Langkawi in aid of five homes  The Star Online

HOW far would you go to raise funds for the underprivileged? Best friends and travel show regulars, Mior Luqman Hakim @ Myo Oh Chentaku and Zahir Zainuddin, are willing to cycle more than 550km from Kuala Lumpur to Langkawi to raise funds for five children’s homes. The duo’s journey will be aired live on Malaysia’s online lifestyle channel and video streaming platform hurr.tv under the programme Jejak Terer. They will be without cash and smartphone and will only bring along limited food supply. For every 100km completed, the programme’s main sponsor MyEG Services Bhd has pledged to donate R...

item.title: MyEG to expand to the Philippines in first overseas venture - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG to expand to the Philippines in first overseas venture  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services Bhd (MyEG) is making its first overseas foray, forming a partnership to develop and implement electronic government (e-government) service projects in the Philippines. The e-government services provider told Bursa Malaysia that it had on Wednesday entered into a joint-venture (JV) agreement with I-Pay Commerce Ventures, Inc (IPCVI), a payment processing provider and a direct agent of Western Union in the Philippines. The aim is to establish a JV corporation to undertake e-government and e-government-related services there, including electronic payment services i...

item.title: MyEG’s contract to register foreign workers extended till year-end - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG’s contract to register foreign workers extended till year-end  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services Bhd’s (MyEG) contract to manage the registration of illegal foreign workers under the rehiring programme has been extended until Dec 31, 2017. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the e-Government services provider said it received a notification letter on Monday from the Home Affairs Ministry regarding the extension. The project was originally scheduled to run from Feb 15, 2016, to Aug 15, 2016. MyEG said it would be able to register all foreign workers except those from Myanmar. The company said the project had no fixed value as it depended on the number of illega...

item.title: Five Malaysian companies on Forbes 'Best under a billion' list - The Star Online
item.description:
Five Malaysian companies on Forbes 'Best under a billion' list  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Five Malaysian companies are among the top 200 publicly-traded companies in the Asia-Pacific region which are on Forbes 2017 “Best under a billion” list. The five are Elsoft Research Bhd, Kerjaya Prospek Group Bhd, My E.G. Services Bhd, Pentamaster Bhd and Vitrox Corporation Bhd. According to Forbes on Thursday, the list honors the leading stock-traded companies in the Asia Pacific region with annual revenue between US$5mil and US$1bil. “From a universe of 18,000 candidates, roughly 875 passed our criteria for profitability, growth and modest indebtedness,” it said. The result...

item.title: MyEG posts another solid set of results - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG posts another solid set of results  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services Bhd’s (MyEG) earnings for its second quarter (Q2) ended Dec 31, 2016, grew a strong 57% to RM47.6mil from a year earlier. The electronic government services provider told Bursa Malaysia that the improved profit achieved on 40% higher revenue of RM88.7mil were due mainly to two factors. These are higher transaction volumes from the online renewal of foreign workers’ permits and insurance (FWP) and foreign worker rehiring programme services, and an increase in revenue contribution from its motor vehicle trading-related services. The company posted a 49.9% boost in...

item.title: MyEG diversifies portfolio - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG diversifies portfolio  The Star Online

MD Wong says company intends to increase the percentage of its commercial business. PETALING JAYA: My EG Services Bhd (MyEG) has brushed aside notion that the bulk of its business activities were dependent on the Government. It said that commercial solutions and services now make up 70% of the group’s business activities, thus no longer rendering it just a concession for various e-government applications. According to MyEG managing director Wong Thean Soon, better known as T.S. Wong (pic), the company intends to increase the percentage of its commercial business. At the same time, MyEG feel...

item.title: My EG’s GST monitoring launch set for end-2017 - The Star Online
item.description:
My EG’s GST monitoring launch set for end-2017  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services’ GST monitoring (GSM) project’s Phase 1 nationwide launch is taking longer than expected and the target launch is now set for end-2017 versus June 2017 previously, according to CIMB Equities Research. It said on Wednesday MyEG faced some teething problems in the past few months during the installation of dongles at the older cash registers (more than five years old) in F&B outlets in Klang Valley. “However, it said all issues have been resolved. MyEG has so far installed 5,000 dongles in Klang Valley in F&B outlets and is targeting to install nationwide by year-...

item.title: 12 held over foreign workers permit scam - The Star Online
item.description:
12 held over foreign workers permit scam  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Twelve people, including two women, who acted as middlemen and agents to help renew temporary foreign workers permits (PLKS) have been detained by anti-graft officers in a sting operation. The suspects, aged between 33 and 50, were rounded up during simultaneous raids at about 11am yesterday in four states. They were picked up in Selangor, Johor, Penang and Perak. Sources said the arrests were conducted by the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) through information obtained from MyEG Services Bhd. “Based on intelligence and sharing of information, we found elements of...

item.title: Trading ideas: Sime Darby, LBS, MyEG, Kimlun - The Star Online
item.description:
Trading ideas: Sime Darby, LBS, MyEG, Kimlun  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: JF Apex Research expects Sime Darby, Press Metal, LBS, MRCB, Destini, Kerjaya Prospek, Mitrajaya, MyEG, Chin Hin and Kimlun to attract positive trading interest after they reported an improvement in corporate earnings. It said on Tuesday other stocks which could see trading interest Sunway, Aeon, UMW, 7-Eleven, OCK, TSH, UEM Sunrise, Protasco and JAKS Resources. JF Apex Research said Titijaya Land is buying a company that owns three plots of leasehold land in Sabah, measuring 75.44 acres for RM70.9il. It is partnering China Railway Engineering Ltd to undertake a mixed-use pro...

item.title: Trading ideas: MyEG, Inari, SapuraKencana, Wah Seong - The Star Online
item.description:
Trading ideas: MyEG, Inari, SapuraKencana, Wah Seong  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: JF Apex Research expects MyEG Services, Inari Amertron, SapuraKencana Petroleum and Wah Seong to be among the stocks which could see trading interest on Friday. It said MyEG has confirmed that the five-year government concession to provide online renewal of temporary employment passes for foreign workers is valued at RM553.85mil. Earlier, MyEG said it had signed the concession agreement on March 1 to provide the service from May 23, 2015 to May 22, 2020. Inari Amertron has terminated its plan to form a joint venture with a Taiwanese firm to provide outsourced semiconductor ass...

item.title: Bursa Malaysia-listed firms in the ecosystem - The Star Online
item.description:
Bursa Malaysia-listed firms in the ecosystem  The Star Online

HEITECH PADU BHD THE information technology services provider had in October last year received a further three-year contract valued at RM42.43mil to maintain and service the Immigration Department’s Malaysian Immigration System (myIMMs). According to a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the contract will run from Aug 18, 2017, to Aug 17, 2020. Any renewal would be at the government’s discretion, it states. myIMMs is an online service provided by the Immigration Department. The system, among others, provides access to foreign domestic helpers’ visas and passes applications or renewals by employers...

item.title: MyEG confirms value of concession at RM553mil - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG confirms value of concession at RM553mil  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: My E.G. Services Bhd (MyEG) has confirmed that the five-year concession given by the Government to provide online renewal of temporary employment passes for foreign workers is valued at RM553.85mil. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the group said it had signed the concession agreement on March 1 to provide the service from May 23, 2015 to May 22, 2020. The online renewal of the employment pass, also known as Pas Lawatan Kerja Sementara (PLKS), will be provided for the Immigration Department of Malaysia. The concession is renewable upon expiry subject to the Government’s appro...

item.title: Five M'sian companies on Forbes' 'best under a billion' list - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

Five Malaysian companies -- Elsoft Research Bhd, Kerjaya Prospek Group Bhd, MyEG Services Bhd, Pentamaster Corp Bhd and Vitrox Corp Bhd, are on Forbes 2017 “Best Under A Billion” list. The annual list highlights 200 public companies in Asia Pacific with less than US$1 billion in revenue, and have a consistent top- and bottom-line growth. According to Forbes' website, this year’s candidates are from 13 countries and averaged 55 percent growth in sales, 24 percent in profit margin, and 113 percent growth in earnings per share. Only 70 of these small- to medium-sized enterprises generated reve...

item.title: Foreign funds sell RM63.1mil Malaysian equities - The Star Online
item.description:
Foreign funds sell RM63.1mil Malaysian equities  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: After four weeks of meandering, foreign funds took a breather in Malaysia as ratcheting political tensions hurt their risk appetite, according to MIDF Research. The research house said that for the week ended Aug 11, 2017, the net amount sold off by foreign investors was RM63.1mil, based on transactions in the open market which excluded off market deals. “Foreign funds were net sellers in three out of five trading days. Foreign selling peaked on Friday as foreigners disposed of RM93.5mil net, the highest in a day since July 5,” MIDF said in its weekly fund flow report. It adde...

item.title: CIMB Research retains Add for MY EG at RM3.14 on Manila JV - The Star Online
item.description:
CIMB Research retains Add for MY EG at RM3.14 on Manila JV  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Equities Research is retaining its target price of RM3.14 for MY EG Services which is 72.5% above the last traded price of RM1.82. It said on Thursday that it was maintaining its earnings per share (EPS) forecast and target price, based on an unchanged 25.2 times 2018 price-to-earnings (P/E), a 20% premium over its 21 times P/E target for the technology sector. “The premium is justified by its 53.6% 3-year EPS CAGR (FY17-19F). A successful launch of the GST monitoring project and this Philippines venture are potential re-rating catalysts. Risks include weak registration o...

item.title: MyEG revenue and profit higher - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG revenue and profit higher  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: My EG Services Bhd’s (MyEG) net profit for the fourth quarter rose 16.7% to RM59.48mil while revenue jumped 20.3% to RM105.1mil. The e-government services provider’s higher earnings and revenue were attributed to higher transaction volume from the online renewal of foreign workers’ permits (FWP), foreign workers rehiring programme services (FWR Services) and foreign workers’ insurance from both FWP and FWR Services. The group also saw an increase in revenue contribution from its motor vehicle trading-related services for the quarter ended June 30, 2017. In its filing with the...

item.title: Analyst Reports - The Star Online
item.description:
Analyst Reports  The Star Online

THONG GUAN INDUSTRIES BHD By Kenanga Research Outperform (upgrade) Target price: RM5.40 KENANGA Research has raised its target price for Thong Guan to RM5.40 from RM4.76 previously. The brokerage has also upgraded its rating on the counter to “outperform” from “market perform”, citing that Thong Guan’s fundamentals remain intact, while upsides are attractive at current share price level which has corrected by about 8% since the end of February this year. Kenanga Research says its new target price for Thong Guan is based on a valuation of 14.6 times the estimated earnings per share (EPS) of ...

item.title: MyEg gets contract extension - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEg gets contract extension  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: My EG Services Bhd’s (MyEG) contract to manage the registration of illegal foreign workers under the rehiring programme has been extended until Dec 31, 2017. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the e-Government services provider said it received a notification letter yesterday from the Home Affairs Ministry for the extension. The project was originally scheduled to run from Feb 15, 2016, to Aug 15, 2016.

item.title: MyEG posts higher quarterly net profit of RM54mil - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG posts higher quarterly net profit of RM54mil  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: My EG Services Bhd (MyEG) recorded a 62.8% year-on-year (y-o-y) higher net profit for the third quarter of the financial year ended March 31, 2017 on the back of higher transaction volumes for its foreign workers-related services and increase in revenue contribution from its motor vehicle trading related services. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the e-Government services provider announced that its bottom line was up to RM53.9mil compared with the RM33.11mil earnings registered a year earlier. MyEG’s top line also showed a significant improvement as it increased by 41.5% y-o...

item.title: UOB Kay Hian Research retains buy on My EG - The Star Online
item.description:
UOB Kay Hian Research retains buy on My EG  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UOB Kay Hian Malaysia Research is maintaining its Buy call on My E.G. Services with an unchanged target price of RM1.62, implying 20 times 2019F price-to-earnings. It said on Wednesday the stock has fallen 30% from its recent high of RM1.79. “The approval of first tranche of application of foreign worker recruitment service serves as a catalyst to the company as it shows that My EG still remains relevant in the foreign worker-related space,” it said. To recap, UOB Kay Hian Research understands that the Immigration Department has approved the first batch of recruitment applica...

item.title: MyEG climbs on positive news - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG climbs on positive news  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Shares in MyEG Services Bhd jumped, as investors waded in to scoop up the stock at lower prices following Friday’s steep decline. The stock was the most actively traded stock yesterday with 175.6 million shares changing hands. It shot up 25 sen, or 20%, to close at RM1.38. The company told Bursa Malaysia after trading had ended on Friday that it had received a letter from the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) confirming that it was not under investigation in relation to charges against former deputy prime minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi. “With the MACC’s c...

item.title: CIMB Research sees My EG oversold, keeps TP RM1.81 - The Star Online
item.description:
CIMB Research sees My EG oversold, keeps TP RM1.81  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Equities Research believe the plunge in My EG Services share price last Friday by 30% to a low of RM1.05 could be an opportunity to accumulate the stock. It said on Monday the key earnings driver for the stock in FY19-20F is the online registration of new foreign workers (NFWs) which MyEG has recently received the approval for from the government. “We have assumed in our conservative earnings forecasts that MyEG recruits and registers 50,000 NFWs annually in 2019/20F. We understand that the company could generate around RM2,000 revenue per NFW. “Based on these assumptions...

item.title: MyEG denies knowledge of firm, director who allegedly bribed Zahid - Malaysia Today
item.description:
MyEG denies knowledge of firm, director who allegedly bribed Zahid  Malaysia Today

(MMO) – MyEG Services Bhd has denied knowing the person and the company that allegedly paid former home minister Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi millions in bribes to secure projects from the listed firm. Responding to articles linking it and Datasonic Group Bhd to the extensive corruption and money laundering charges against Zahid, MyEG insisted it never paid any fee or was party to any such payment to secure its appointment as a online service provider for the government. It also stressed that the charges filed today were all against the former deputy prime minister personally. “The Company...

item.title: MyEG, Datasonic drop sharply - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG, Datasonic drop sharply  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Shares of MyEG Services Bhd and Datasonic Group Bhd were pummelled after both companies were believed to be linked to graft charges against former deputy prime minister Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi, who is also current Umno president. In a subsequent statement to Bursa, MyEG said it had received a letter from the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission confirming and clarifying that MyEG and its board of directors are not under investigation and are not party to the investigation revolving around Zahid. Earlier, trading of MyEG shares was suspended after the company asked for it...

item.title: Trading in My EG shares suspended - The Star Online
item.description:
Trading in My EG shares suspended  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Trading in the shares of My EG Service Bhd has been suspended for the remainder of the day pending an announcement. In a filing with the stock exchange, My EG said it will make announcement to clarify the news article appearing on theedgemarkets.com titled "Datasonic, MyEG implicated in charges against Zahid". My EG's share price had hit limit down following a sharp plunge in the late-morning session as news broke that it had been implicated in corruption charges against former deputy prime minister Datuk Ahmad Zahid Hamidi. At 12.30pm, the stock was trading 37 sen or 25% lowe...

item.title: TS Wong increases stake in Excel Force - The Star Online
item.description:
TS Wong increases stake in Excel Force  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: MyEG Services Bhd managing director Wong Thean Soon, better known as TS Wong (pic), is increasing his stake in financial software player Excel Force MSC Bhd (Eforce). The company, in a filing with Bursa Malaysia, said Wong had acquired 142,000 shares via the open market yesterday, bringing his direct stake in the company to 4.667%. His indirect interest in the company stands at 20.2%, via Asia Internet Holdings Sdn Bhd, which is the single largest shareholder in Eforce. Filings showed that Wong has been acquiring more shares in the company since Sept 7, before which, his dire...

item.title: Shareholder rejuvenates MyEG - The Star Online
item.description:
Shareholder rejuvenates MyEG  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: An off-market transaction where the major shareholders of MyEg Services Bhd disposed of 1.4% of the e-service provider has sparked off speculation of a new shareholder in the company. Asia Internet Holdings Sdn Bhd, the private company controlling MyEG disposed of the 50 million shares in a transaction that took place on Aug 16. Following this transaction, Asia Internet still owns 1.04 billion shares or 29.26% interest in the company. Sources said the purchaser of the block of shares was a person connected to the Pakatan Harapan administration and expected to bring some sense...

item.title: MY EG Services cut to Hold after share price rally - The Star Online
item.description:
MY EG Services cut to Hold after share price rally  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UOB Kay Hian Malaysia Research has downgraded MY E.G. Services to Hold as the share price rallied 47% in the past month and increase its target price to RM1.27 as it rolls forward its valuation to 2019. Entry price: RM1.14. It said on Friday while MYEG remains relevant as an indispensable enabler of e-government services that cuts down red tape and corruption, it requires government resolution to commence various earnings-accretive catalysts. The research house said while the pilot stage of e-bidding services for vehicle plates which was supposed to start on Aug 1 was delayed,...

item.title: Can MyEG bounce back? - The Star Online
item.description:
Can MyEG bounce back?  The Star Online

MyEG Services Bhd is working its way to regain investors’ confidence and to reaffirm the company’s business momentum. Aside from its existing works, it is believed that the company is also currently working on several new projects that are related to government services. Examples of the new projects include a reporting system for the yet-to-be-launched sales and services tax and a new module for foreign workers. These are on top of the group’s increasing foreign ventures, which were initiated two to three years ago and are starting to show traction. In a reply to StarBizWeek, MyEG says it a...

item.title: MyEG working on new module for foreign workers - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG working on new module for foreign workers  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MyEG Services has been working on a Sales and Service Tax (SST) system which the new government could use to reduce leakages when the SST is launched in September and also a new module for foreign workers, says CIMB Equities Research. In its research note issued yesterday, the research house said the company was also looking to launch a new remittance service for foreign workers but the timing of the launch has not been announced yet. “We understand MyEG is also looking to launch e-government services in Bangladesh,” it said. CIMB Research said the Pakatan Harapan government s...

item.title: MyEG working on new domestic projects - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG working on new domestic projects  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MyEG has been working on a Sales and Service Tax (SST) system which the new government could use to reduce leakages when the SST is launched in September and also a new module for foreign workers, says CIMB Equities Research. In its research note issued on Monday, it said the company was also looking to launch a new remittance service for foreign workers but the timing of the launch has not been announced yet. “We understand MyEG is also looking to launch e-government services in Bangladesh,” it said. CIMB Research said the Pakatan Harapan government should decide in the next ...

item.title: MyEG signs MoU in the Philippines - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG signs MoU in the Philippines  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: An associate of My E.G. Services Bhd (MyEG) has entered into a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to register as a licence applicant to act as a payment processor and gateway business enterprise in the Philippines. The group told Bursa Malaysia that its associate I-Pay MYEG Philippines Inc (IPMPI) signed the MoU on June 18 with the Cagayan Economic Zone Authority (Ceza). This is to allow the company to register as a Financial Technology Solutions Business Enterprise licence applicant. The move will enable it to act as a payment processor and gateway business enterprise for off...

item.title: CIMB Research keeps forecasts, target price for MyEG - The Star Online
item.description:
CIMB Research keeps forecasts, target price for MyEG  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Equities Research is keeping its forecasts and target price of RM1.22 for MyEG Services Bhd, based on a technology sector 2019 target price-to-earnings (P/E) of 15 times. It said a potential re-rating catalyst is MyEG winning a contract to monitor Malaysia’s upcoming Sales and Services Tax (SST). “A downside risk is liberalisation of the domestic car roadtax and foreign worker working permit renewal services, which may open MyEG’s niche segment to other players,” said the research unit. On Wednesday evening, MyEG announced that its associate I-Pay MyEG Philippines Inc (IP...

item.title: MyEG most active counter in early trade - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG most active counter in early trade  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MyEG Services Bhd is the most active stock traded in early trade Thursday following news that its associate seeks to be payment processor in the Philippines. The counter gained 3%, or three sen to RM1.03 with 28 million shares traded. MyEG's associate company has inked a preliminary agreement seeking to be a payment processor and payment gateway business enterprise for offshore transactions in the Philippines' Cagayan Special Economic Zone and Freeport. The associate I-Pay MyEG Philippines Inc signed the Memorandum of Understanding with the Cagayan Economic Zone Authority on M...

item.title: MyEG optimistic about its prospects - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG optimistic about its prospects  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: MyEG Services Bhd remains optimistic about its prospects, particularly its Philippines joint venture (JV) and e-bidding for new car number plates, say analysts. According to CIMB Research, the positive or potentially positive developments for MyEG is that it holds the concession for e-bidding service for new car number plates, the current monitoring system meant for goods and services tax could be revived by the new government for sales and services tax, submission of a proposal to handle online registration for new foreign workers, as well as the Philippines JV which could t...

item.title: MyEG rebounds from share sell down - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG rebounds from share sell down  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MyEG Services Bhd’s shares rebounded in early trade Tuesday from a heavy selldown yesterday, following a negative reaction from investors on its contract. The counter, which tumbled 20% to a new low yesterday, saw its shares climb 5.84%, or four sen to 72.5 sen. It is the second most active counter with 30 million shares traded. MyEG has clarified that the company’s contract for the management of illegal foreign workers for rehiring in Malaysia is already scheduled to end on June 30. It had on Jan 23, 2017 announced that it had received a notification letter from the Ministry ...

item.title: MyEG shares plunge 20% on contract termination - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG shares plunge 20% on contract termination  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Shares in MyEG Services Bhd plunged over 21% in early trade after the Government terminated the management of illegal foreign workers for the rehiring programme. MyEG is one of the biggest losers, falling 21.51%, or 18.5 sen to 67.5 sen. It is the most active counter with 113 million shares traded. Earlier, it fell to a low of 65.5 sen. The stock has fallen some 69% year-to-date. MyEG will see its contract with the Immigration Department to carry out the government’s rehiring exercise of undocumented foreign workers being terminated by the end of the month. This morning, MyEG ...

item.title: MyEG shares plunge amid threat from new players - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG shares plunge amid threat from new players  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: MyEG Services Bhd’s share price plunged to a new low amid growing worries that its dominant role as the e-services provider to the government is under threat from new players. The stock tumbled 17.5 sen, or 20%, yesterday to close at 68.5 sen. CIMB Research, in a note, said the opening up of the “niche segment” represents a downside risk for the company. Shares in MyEG have been under pressure following the government’s move to abolish the goods and services tax (GST) and replace it with the sales and services tax (SST). MyEG provides the monitoring services for the GST, whic...

item.title: MyEG Services falls, says rehiring project to end on June 30 (Update) - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG Services falls, says rehiring project to end on June 30 (Update)  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MyEG Services share price fell to a low of 65.5 sen early Monday on concerns about the termination of the management of illegal foreign workers for the rehiring programme. Bursa Malaysia Securities had at 9.09am suspended the proprietary day trading and intra-day short selling after the share price fell more than the 15 sen limit. Before market opened for trading, MyEG issued a statement that the programme was already scheduled to end on June 30. It had on Jan 23, 2017 announced it had received a notification letter from the Ministry of Home Affairs that the programme was unti...

item.title: Immigration Dept ends rehiring programme, impacts MyEG and two others - The Star Online
item.description:
Immigration Dept ends rehiring programme, impacts MyEG and two others  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: E-government services provider, MyEG Services Bhd, whose share price has come under pressure since the change in government will be dealt with another blow by end of June. Its contract to provide services for the Immigration Department under the re-hiring of undocumented foreign workers scheme would be terminated by end of the month. According to the report by an online news website, the services of three company -- MyEG Services Sdn Bhd, Iman Resources Sdn Bhd and Bukti Megah Sdn Bhd – would be terminated by end of the month. It quoted Immigration Department’s director gene...

item.title: MyEG’s share price has bottomed out, says CIMB Research - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG’s share price has bottomed out, says CIMB Research  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MyEG Services’ share price has bottomed after overcoming its immediate-term resistance trend line at 77.5 sen last Thursday, says CIMB Equities Research. It said on Monday this immediate-term bottom was supported by the high trading volume of around 600 million shares last Thursday. “In addition, the daily RSI remains oversold at only 19.9 points, an indication the stock is long overdue for a technical rebound. The share price fell around 70% after the recent general election (GE),” it said. CIMB Research said MyEG remains an Add. Its target price of RM1.22 remains the technol...

item.title: MyEG hopeful on relationship with new govt - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG hopeful on relationship with new govt  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: E-government provider MyEG Services Bhd is cautiously optimistic that it will be able to work with the new Government of the day, and continue to roll out new e-government services while maintaining the service level of the current services which will continue to benefit the Malaysian public, consistent with the new Government’s manifesto. In a results filing with Bursa Malaysia detailing its prospects moving forward, MyEG said that in view of the recent pronouncements of the new Government to abolish the current GST regime, MyEG wishes to clarify that the company will wait f...

item.title: MyEG contract to be terminated by end-June - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG contract to be terminated by end-June  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: My E.G. Services Bhd (MyEG) will see its contract with the Immigration Department to carry out the government’s rehiring exercise of undocumented foreign workers being terminated by the end of the month. The company together with two other vendor companies: Iman Resources Sdn Bhd and Bukti Megah Sdn Bhd will see their contracts eventually ending, an online news portal quoted Immigration Department director-general Mustafar Ali as saying. Home Minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin had earlier said that the re-hiring exercise will end and that after it ends, all dealings with vendo...

item.title: Unhappiness at Hengyuan - The Star Online
item.description:
Unhappiness at Hengyuan  The Star Online

IT was just five months ago when shareholders of Hengyuan Refining Company Bhd were riding high. The company’s shares were one of the best performing on Bursa Malaysia for 2017. The company reported spectacular profits for that year, and investors were looking forward to its share price surpassing RM20 apiece. Fast forward to today and Hengyuan is trading at a mere RM7 a share, and for its first quarter ended March 31, earnings plunged by a massive 69% to RM86.8mil from RM279.5 mil a year earlier. The company has declared a mere two-sen dividend. To be fair, Hengyuan’s earnings are co-relat...

item.title: MyEG tumbles, PDT and IDSS suspended again - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG tumbles, PDT and IDSS suspended again  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The proprietary day trading (PDT) and intra-day short selling (IDSS) for MyEG Services Bhd were suspended early Thursday after its share price fell more than the designated level. At 9.31, it had fall 15.5 sen to a fresh low of 76 sen. It was actively traded with 51.60 million shares done. The FBM KLCI tumbled 30.56 points or 1.69% to 1,773.69. Turnover was 532.34 million shares valued at RM403.66mil. Decliners overwhelmed advancers 563 to 67 while 190 counters were unchanged. Bursa Malaysia Securities said the PDT and IDSS were suspended for the rest of the day after the shar...

item.title: Selling may be over for MyEG, George Kent - The Star Online
item.description:
Selling may be over for MyEG, George Kent  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Shares of MyEG Services and George Kent, which had been battered over the past four trading days, managed to stage a mild rebound early Friday as investors viewed the selling as overdone. AT 9.01am, government service provider MyEG was up 5.5 sen to 96 sen with 6.33 million shares done. Its call warrants C36 was flat at 1.5 sen. George Kent gained nine sen to RM1.60 with 951,300 shares done. George Kent and MRCB are the project delivery partner for the Light Rail Transit from Bandar Utama to Klang. The FBM KLCI rose 5.09 points or 0.27% to 1,859.53. StarBiz reported MyEG manag...

item.title: MyEG has first-mover advantage, says MD - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG has first-mover advantage, says MD  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Government service provider MyEG Services Bhd group managing director Wong Thean Soon said the company has spent close to RM150mil on its Goods and Services Tax (GST) programme, where it has acquired close to 20,000 dongles, and there are grounds to seek compensation should the programme be cancelled. Wong is well known for his position as the managing director and single largest shareholder of MyEG Services Bhd, which had a market capitalisation of some RM7bil prior to the stock hitting limit down on Monday and Tuesday. MyEG, which has lost close to RM3bil in market cap, is ...

item.title: MyEG and George Kent battered again - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG and George Kent battered again  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Shares of Government service provider MyEG Services and George Kent continued to come under heavy seling pressure on Thursday after Bursa Malaysia Securities removed the lower price limit for both counters. At 3.30pm, MyEG tumbled 37.5 sen to 89.5 sen with 365.24 million shares done. It hit limit down when it fell to a low of 89 sen. It is connected with the previous ruling party. George Kent was down 46 sen to RM1.48 with 86.92 million shares done. It fell to a low of RM1.47. The FBM KLCI rose 4.8 points or 0.26% to 1,863.06. Turnover was 2.30 billion shares valued at RM2.34b...

item.title: UOB Kay Hian Research upgrades MyEG to Buy on weakness - The Star Online
item.description:
UOB Kay Hian Research upgrades MyEG to Buy on weakness  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UOB Kay Hian Malaysia Research has upgraded MyEG Services to buy on weakness as the government service provider’s risk-reward profile has turned positive with share price having plunged 65% over the past few days to trade close to its assessed trough value of 84 sen. In its report issued on Friday, it said this comes on the back of heightened fears of political risks, following Pakatan Harapan’s general election win last week. “The risk of its GST monitoring system being scrapped has been fully discounted, and more importantly, we foresee the concession of its efficient e-gov...

item.title: MY EG, George Kent slide early Thursday - The Star Online
item.description:
MY EG, George Kent slide early Thursday  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Share prices of MY EG Services and George Kent came under renewed selling pressure early Thursday after the one-day lower price limit was lifted for both counters. This prompted the regulator Bursa Malaysia Securities to suspend the proprietary day trading (PDT) and intra-day short selling (IDSS) for My EG after the shares fell more than 15 sen or 15%. MY EG fell to a low of RM1.07 and George Kent hit a low of RM1.67. At 9.13am, MY EG had stabilised and was down eight sen to RM1.19 after the PFT and IDSS were suspended. It was actively traded with 91.17 million shares done. G...

item.title: MyEG boss states case for new govt to continue using company’s services - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG boss states case for new govt to continue using company’s services  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Government service provider MyEG Services Bhd managing director and single largest shareholder Wong Thean Soon does not see any reason for the new Pakatan Harapan government not to continue using MyEG as the service provider for e-government services. Presently, MyEG’s various projects are grouped under the e-government concession which was awarded in the year 2000. “MyEG, as a service provider to the government, has to work for the government of the day. “We believe that we are a professional organisation that will continue to provide a high level of service to the governmen...

item.title: Political play evident as market reopens - The Star Online
item.description:
Political play evident as market reopens  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Stocks that are linked to Barisan Nasional fell under heavy selling pressure amid volatile trading on Bursa Malaysia yesterday. The selldown came as no big surprise as analysts predicted that counters that are aligned with Barisan would be the first to feel the brunt from the selling pressure after the shock victory by Pakatan Harapan in the general election. Government services provider MyEG Services Bhd and construction group George Kent Bhd were among the politically-linked stocks that saw their prices hit limit-down since early trading yesterday. At the close, MyEG share ...

item.title: MyEG JV to roll out e-payment services - The Star Online
item.description:
MyEG JV to roll out e-payment services  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: MyEG Services Bhd’s joint venture (JV) will roll out electronic payment services for the collection of taxes, among others, in Quezon City in the Philippines. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the information technology services management company said its JV in the Philippines, I-Pay MYEG Philippines Inc, had entered into a service level agreement with the local government of Quezon to act as the latter’s electronic payment gateway service provider. Apart from tax collection, the JV will also cater to other services offered by the Quezon local government through its payment c...
